result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. SKATTEBO

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

State moves to dismiss and read in these charges.   Defendant entered pleas in Case Files 14 CF 274, 15 CF 185, and 15 CF 383.  Motion granted.   
$50.00 cash bail applied on Case File 14 CF 274.   
Minutes.

The report has been received and reviewed by all parties.  The report finds the defendant competent to proceed in these matter.
The parties do not contest these findings.  The defendant agrees he is competent to proceed.
The court sets a plea date for 09-24-15 at 1:15 p.m. for all pending cases.  He requests that an outline of the plea agreement be filed prior to that date.
Minutes.
of Jenna Hernke, Psy.D.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael L. SKATTEBO
Current: 2319 - 12th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 1607 19th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States
Hearing is set for 08-27-15 at 8:30 a.m.

The matters were set for a plea hearing today. Attorney Ritter informs the Court that the defendant does not want to proceed to a plea and sentencing and wants these matters set for jury trial.
Attorney Ritter also feels he has an ethical duty to inform the court that he is raising the issue of competency  at this time.  The defendant seems to be having a hard time understanding the legal procedure involved with these matters.  He asks the Court to order a competency evaluation.
The Court orders a competency examination of the defendant on all pending files, even the two that are Judge Fox's  and orders the Wisconsin Forensic Unit to conduct the examination.
The Court will draft the necessary order.
(Per Robbie, Judge Fox's cases will just ride along with Branch 1's files.  No specific competency order needs to be done on those two cases)
Minutes.

Defendant's Notice of Change of Address.
Cover letter.

Pretrial conference is set for 06-05-15 at 11:30 a.m.
Jury trial is set for 06-10-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 3 position.
It is hereby ordered, for the reasons stated on the record on 04-01-15, the defendant's motion to suppress is denied.

DECISION ON MOTION TO SUPPRESS EVIDENCE - 
Brief arguments by counsel.
The Court comments and will not suppress the statement and evidence and denies the motion.
State to draft the order.
Scheduling conference is set for 04-06-15 at 4:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Letter from DA LaBre to Judge Rohrer.

Brief in Support of Defendant's Motion to Suppress.
Fax cover page.

Motion to Suppress Evidence
Testimony presented.  Court finds the statement was lawfully obtained and will be admitted.  Court wants to review case law before making the rest of his decision.  Counsel will supplement the motion with a brief to be filed by 03-27-15.  Decision on motion hearing set for 04-01-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Exhibit 1, CCAP entry of bond modifications.

Preliminary hearing held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.

Patrick Ritter through Public Defender

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 01-21-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 01-04-15.

At 2:19 p.m., $50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-12-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs. Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
